casebody.data:
The State of Ohio, Appellant, v. Jones, Appellee.

[Cite as State v. Jones (2000), 89 Ohio St.3d 519.]

(No. 99-1881 Submitted July 25, 2000 Decided August 3, 2000.) William D. Mason, Cuyahoga County Prosecuting Attorney, and Lisa Reitz Williamson, Assistant Prosecuting Attorney, for appellant. David H. Bodiker, Ohio Public Defender, and Alison M. Clark, Assistant State Public Defender; and Lawrence Cook, for appellee.

The judgment of the court of appeals is reversed on the authority of Woods v. Telb (2000), 89 Ohio St.3d 504, 733 N.E.2d 1103, the cause is remanded for judgment consistent with Woods, and the trial court’s denial of appellee’s motion to terminate his post-release control is reinstated.

Moyer, C.J., F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer, Cook and Lundberg Stratton, JJ., concur. Douglas, J., dissents. Resnick, J., not participating.
